website_summaries.verdict: Three different sizes and highly compressible memory foam make this camping pillow the best option for anyone’s needs.
pros: Top notch memory foam that makes you feel like you're sleeping at home
Easily compresses down with the included compression sack
Made with soft suede material on the outside
cons: Compression sack is larger than the competition – not going to be the best for backpacking

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I got this pillow for a 100-mile hike. I also ordered a blow-up pillow to compare. Comfort is important to me so natural I like this one. While the blow-up is very small while packed, it's like sleeping on a pool raft. This is similar to a my pillow. Cut up foam and a really soft pillowcase! I can deal with its larger compressed size. A good nights sleep is important on the trail. It can be compressed with a sleeping bag if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller stuff sack please!
customer_reviews.text: Great little pillow, provides support and fluffs up nicely. I had to deduct a star because the stuff sack should be considerably smaller. The pillow can compress much smaller than the sack, so it expands to fit the sack and doesnt save nearly as much space as it could.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable pillow!
customer_reviews.text: The Wise Owl Outfitters Camping Pillow is going on a trip that I need a pillow for 10 days. Tried it out at home. It's really comfortable. I gifted the friend I'm traveling with, who also found it really comfortable. It's not big, but it's large enough for sleeping comfortably. It's NOT flat. It doesn't flip you around like the air pillows, it's not hot like some pillows, it packs neatly and nice into about 9" x 4 1/2". It's a super light pillow. It will work great for camping, canoe camping - everything except for the "ultralight" camping folks. I highly recommend this pillow!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Nice pillow
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a flight this fall. I have one of those u-shaped pillows that I have used in the past and didn't like. This pillow seems like it's going to suit my purposes. It fluffed up great and I love how it comes with it's own bag. It was easy to roll back up & put in the bag. I'm very pleased with my purchase. I also like the fact that the cover zips off for washing.
customer_reviews.author: S McD

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Oooh I love this pillow. I have a hard time sleeping on the pillows at the relatives’ homes. Spend a whole week tossing and turning. This pillow is so comfortable and actually rolls back up into the little bag. I bought the 12”x16” so it will fit nicely into my luggage. Really happy with my purchase. Edit: Even better, it washes really well. Dried in dryer with dryer balls to fluff it up. Worked wonderfully!
customer_reviews.author: G’s mom

customer_reviews.title: Rolls up, so it doesn’t take up space!
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is perfect for hiking and camping! It is compressible, so you can roll it up and take it with you without compromising space in or on your pack! (The carrying pouch can be strapped to your pack through the loop on the bottom!) It’s fluffy and soft, and my favorite part is that the cover is removable as well, so you can wash it after your adventures!
customer_reviews.author: Cassidey D.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable pillow, NOT for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of ordering this pillow without reading extensive reviews or assuming it would really be compressible. I used it for a 4 day backpacking trip and while it was mostly comfortable, it is SUPER bulky. I think calling it compressible is a far stretch. Update to my initial review: this is an amazing company! After leaving a review, they reached out to me and offered me a very small, inflatable pillow, more suitable for backpacking - FOR FREE! How awesome is that! I can't recommend these guys enough, and they're from the Seattle, and I'm biased to the Pacific NW ;)
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy McAllister

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I sleep on this pillow as good or better than the pillow that I use at home. Got this for car camping situations and for airline type travel where space is limited but the extra weight of the pillow is not a concern. I have purchased just about every backpacking pillow out there and have not had any luck in finding a pillow that I can comfortably sleep with. I bought this one even though it is quite a bit heavier than most backpacking pillows just to give it a try. The support and comfort is outstanding. Now I just have to justify the weight and size by eliminating something else so I can sleep comfortably in the back country!
customer_reviews.author: Charles McKenney

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this pillow while relaxing on my couch and contemplating buying another one for evenings relaxing out on the patio in my zero gravity chair. It is worth noting that I did read reviews and almost didn't purchase this item. Upon arrival, I did pull the pillow out of the cover. I did discover a break in the stitching. Ok, no problem. I grabbed my little sewing kit and hand stitched the seam then out the pillow back into the cover. Problem solved. No, I do not think I should have had to do that but the price, color and comfortable nature of this little pillow seemed worth it to just stitch up the 2 or so inch.
customer_reviews.author: V. Heldenbrand

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Backpacking Pillow
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a backpacking trip. I had always been a rollup your cloths and use that as your pillow type of packer, but after 20 years of backpacking decided to give a pillow a try. This pillow fit the needs of cost, size, and weight I was looking for. It far exceeded my expectations and I have no idea why I did not buy a pillow sooner. I slept better, was comfortable all night long, and really did not notice the weight of it in my pack. I will be buying more of these next season for my kids who are now hooked on packing as well.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Conley

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, pack down reasonable small.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the large size. These are really comfortable for camp pillows, and they compress pretty well. While obviously they don't pack as small as an inflatable pillow, to me the extra bulk is worth it for the comfort. They're filled with pieces of foam, so you need to give them a good shake out after being compressed to re-distribute.
customer_reviews.author: Alix Grabowski

customer_reviews.title: Amazing , simply amazing
customer_reviews.text: I tried and inflatable pillow and I think they work for many. I was told maybe this was a better option for me. I went they the reviews and decided on the large. The size and weight are a trade off for comfort. But holy cow this is a wonderful and amazing pillow for me. Without question it is the correct pillow for me.
customer_reviews.author: WillZ

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy rugged pillow
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is a little bit bulkier than we wanted for backpacking Europe, BUT it was very comfy. Husband and I used them every night for 2 weeks and we had no neck pain and slept quite well. We had to clip them outside our packs because of them being a little bulky, but because they’re light it wasn’t a big deal. I was glad to have them because I did sleep well and that matters a lot when you’re in a tent! They also held up well to rugged treatment and dirty campers. Wise Owl truly makes great quality stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannon Panthers

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered this pillow and the coop home goods travel pillow for a trip. I received both and although I really really wanted to like this pillow it was no where near as comfortable as the other one I purchased. I am sending it back - the $5.99 that I am being nailed to return it....Don't waste your money or time on this pillow. It is lumpy and flat and just not comfy. The bag it came in was nice! And I love the name of the company! The product honestly just needs to be better.
customer_reviews.author: MaisiB

customer_reviews.title: I sleep with it every night
customer_reviews.text: I do not use this for traveling, I wanted a small pillow for my neck when I watch TV in my bed. It is true that at first its very stiff. I haven't washed it either. I just shook it and left it there for a few hours. It is not as soft and fluffy as a regular pillow. Yes you can feel it has some parts of sponges (not sure if thats the right word) inside the pillow. But I eventually forget about it. It has good support and its comfy. I sleep with it every night.
customer_reviews.author: Mags

customer_reviews.title: SO much better than a blow up travel pillow!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pillow, used while traveling in car & camping. I believe I got the smallest size and was concerned it would be too small, but it was just right! It's super comfy and stays in place so much better than the blow up/inflatable one that my boyfriend has. It is a little difficult to get back into the stuff sack - I almost wish there were straps to hold it together while you're trying to pull the sack over it, but with a little practice I'm sure I'll get better at it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I don't like giving bad reviews especially when it comes to pillows because everyone has their favorite pillow that they like. So for me, I did not like this pillow at all. My husband on the other hand loves it. The pillow resembles the "my pillow" alot with that lumpy firm feeling. So I would say if you are a fan of the "my pillow" you will like this travel pillow. If you're not a fan of "my pillow" you will not like it at all. it all comes down to preference.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Good pillow, will do for backpacking but wish it packed down smaller.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pillow for backpacking/camping, in the compact size, it's comfortable enough, seems durable, and fits in a pack fairly easily. I do wish, that they gave you a compression sack or something for it, since as it is now, it packs pretty big, about the size of a football. It's not ultralight, but light enough. Definitely recommend this pillow unless you're working with a small pack or going ultralight. One downside to consider is it won't fit in sleeping bag pillow pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking!
customer_reviews.text: I am very picky about pillows. I have crammed my heavy tempurpedic pillow into my carry-on luggage on trips to both France and Italy because I need a comfy pillow. I have tried inflatable pillows for backpacking but they are just not at all comfortable. I bought this pillow because it seemed to check all the boxes for me - memory foam, lightweight, stuff sac, washable cover. I took it backpacking this past weekend and it was GREAT! Easy to pack back into the stuff sack, super comfortable and lightweight. I have convinced my husband to get one - he has always just wadded up his clothes for a pillow - he now knows this is WAY better!
customer_reviews.author: HJ Ratcliff

customer_reviews.title: Not a ul/backpack pillow
customer_reviews.text: I got the largest size, it’s a good car camping pillow for sure! I wasn’t sure how small it would pack down. I got it for a kayaking camping trip But I’ll probably leave it home. I kinda wish it packed down more so I could fit it in my backpack. I kinda imagined it to be about the same size of a hammock packed up. It seems to be just a normal pillow with a bag. I love wise owl products and I’ve gotten pretty much all their stuff. This is a good product, just not for a backpack trip. Maybe I’ll try another size idk.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeybane

customer_reviews.title: Good little pillow
customer_reviews.text: This pillow, size small, and the Thermarest foam pillow, are both much better than the My Pillow travel pillow, which is comparable in price only if you get a 2-for-1 deal. Of course it all depends on your preferences - I like more support rather than less, more firm than soft - that's what's most comfortable for me. I would buy this again. I would buy the Thermarest foam pillow again. But I will not buy the My Pillow travel pillow again.
customer_reviews.author: The Lawn RangerTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: lumpy, not comfortable, makes crunchy sounds
customer_reviews.text: full disclosure: i'm not a big camper these days and only got this as a compact substitute pillow to use on linen laundry days and store away in its bag the rest of the time. there is nothing "memory foam like" about this pillow. it's lumpy, loud/crunchy, and not especially comfortable. it definitely seems sturdy though, so if you like a firm pillow and can live with a SHHSHHSHH noise in your ear any time you roll over or adjust the pillow, this might be for you
customer_reviews.author: vanguard

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping stomache sleepers
customer_reviews.text: This pillow stuffs down to the size of a rolled up sweater. I biked across the United States and camped every night. I found this pillow extremely comfortable for someone who sleep on their stomache and lets their head hang off the side of the pillow to breathe and drool. I think I feel a bond towards this stupid pillow because of the adventure we went on together and I think you should experience that bond as well and buy this lovely pillow
customer_reviews.author: Ashton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Camping
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pillow to use when hiking or camping, and came across this. It's really comfortable to sleep on! And I'm somewhat picky when it comes to my pillows. It kept its shape and didn't deflate too much upon using it. It is rather large though, so if you're backpacking it isn't the most convenient thing to try and shove in your bag (however, it is really light). 10/10 would recommend and the color is beautiful (I purchased the red).
customer_reviews.author: Maia

customer_reviews.title: Very, very good little pillow
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is surprisingly good. I didn't buy it for travel; I just wanted a little pillow to prop up my head on top of my sofa pillow for watching TV. It is "moldable" so it is comfortable, supportive, and pleasant without being too soft or too firm. It's in the "sweet spot" of where you need a pillow. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mollie C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping but not so much for traveling
customer_reviews.text: It is great for camping and hiking but not for intended for short travels as it is quite a hassle to get the pillow back in its pack, you can do it with no problem when you are packing back your base camp but it is too long of a process for doing it when everyone is de-boarding. So if you want a pillow for traveling just get a neck one that rolls up or something similar. Avoid the ones you have to pack in order to make them portable.
customer_reviews.author: Martin P

customer_reviews.title: Comforts of home.
customer_reviews.text: At home I like multiple pillows, so when I camp I usually sleep very uncomfortably. UNTIL I found the wise owl pillows. I ordered the medium and used it for about a year. It was a great balance of weight and size for backpacking trips. I love that it isn’t noisy like inflatables and is the perfect stiffness for me. I did purchase this larger one now to add for Car camping trips. Its a little bulky for backpacking, but still of very light weight and almost as large as a srandard pillow from home. Ahhhhh comfort.
customer_reviews.author: D. Moultrie

customer_reviews.title: 12”/16” pillow
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is super light and awesome. I got the 12”/16” for the intention to use it for hammocking, and that’s what I can say this version is good for. If you use tent to sleep in I’d highy recomend a bigger pillow, because if your a tosser while sleeping, you’ll roll right off the pillow. The only draw back that I don’t like but will deal with, is the foam inside the pillow. Once I lay my head down and my ear is engulfed into the pillow I hear loud crunching. Now this is very minor to the actual performance. If you want something light and comfortable for backpacking or camping I do recomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great camping pillow
customer_reviews.text: I’m surprised how comfortable this pillow is. It’s big enough (but not too big) for glam-ping or car camping and way more comfortable than an inflatable pillow. It might be a little big for serious backpacking where weight and bulk are a concern, but awesome for most other applications.
customer_reviews.author: Tom K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Depending on your needs!
customer_reviews.text: This was a well-made product. The pillow may be reduced in size by half when put in the stuff bag. The outer material for the pillow had a matte/textured surface. Personally, this did not work for me, as I wanted to pack it down smaller for backpacking, but the stuffing would not allow it to get any smaller than how it already came. Those car camping or going on a plane might prefer these. The padding/stuffing seemed balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Magoo

customer_reviews.title: Great camping/travel pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the medium pillow and it fits my head perfectly. I can even roll side-to side. Great for stomach sleepers. I would probably try to large pillow next time since it is still not as large as a normal sized pillow. There is not much of a smell at all. It is very easy to roll up into the carrying bag. The only improvement I would mention is the carrying bag itself could use reinforcement around the draw-cord opening. Not a big deal at all though.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Great for Car Camping-Probably Good for Hiking (for me)
customer_reviews.text: I take an annual trip with some old friends every year. We camp 4-5 days in one spot. This pillow is perfect car camping. To get the best results from your pillow, pop it in the dryer the day before you go camping. This will really help it expand to give the best comfort. While the pillow does compress and is lightweight, the way I sleep (side sleeper with broad shoulders), an inflatable would probably work better for hiking. But in a pinch, this pillow would still work well.
customer_reviews.author: OSUMule

customer_reviews.title: The perfect nap pillow
customer_reviews.text: Since we are all stuck inside due to quarantine I have set up a scheduled nap time. This little pillow is comfy, rolls up small and has become a fast favorite. I can't wait to get out side and use it for naps in the park or beach days. I'm happy with this pillow and would highly recommend it if youre looking for something soft and compact.
customer_reviews.author: crystal cooper

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lot of coaxing
customer_reviews.text: When I got the pillow, I took it out of the sack and left it alone for 30 minutes to expand. When I came back, it was still very lopsided. It took a bit of coaxing, but I got it to the right shape. It was quite comfortable to sleep on though. The fabric is nice and soft against your face. When it came to putting it back in the sack it once again took a lot of coaxing. It's quite a tight fit. I like it, all-in-all, but it's not as simple as they claim it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Medium is half the size of a regular bedroom pillow
customer_reviews.text: I Bought 2 of these pillows for camping. They are great. I read the reviews prior and think that some people just arent doing things correctly. Both pillows were whole and intact when we opened them. No holes rips or tears. Both were easy to place back into their bags by one person (but having a second pair of hands definitely made it even easier) the only downside is how small it is. Definitely better for a flight or long car trip because of its size. We got mediums. If you combine two mediums they make a normal size bedroom pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Secreteyez

customer_reviews.title: The fill was "crunchy"
customer_reviews.text: I got this pillow to compare to the other brand I purchased before. For fairness I will leave out the name and brand of the other. When I received the pillow it was low smell and I didn't expect to have any issues. After activating it in the dryer I found that the fill didn't evenly inflate, and there were many small crunchy spots and some sharp crusty edges contented within the fill. I sent the item back. It could be deffective, but the other brand is so good I bought another of theirs.
customer_reviews.author: docbench

customer_reviews.title: Cannot get pillow back in the carrying bag
customer_reviews.text: I washed this item and it expanded nicely. Have not used it yet. I'm basing this review on the fact that I am unable to get this item back in its carrying sack. The fact that it has a carrying bag played a part in my decision to purchase this item. Are there larger carrying bags available?
customer_reviews.author: Curious

customer_reviews.title: Soft and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. No strange smells and very comfortable. Wise Owl has excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Ordered Medium but received Small. Label is also incorrect.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these MEDIUM sized pillows that should measure 14” x 18” according to the description. The labels said they were a size medium but when I took out the pillows and actually measured, they were small sized. Barely even 12” x 16”. Make sure you check that you got the right size!
customer_reviews.author: Jennalyn Macaraeg

customer_reviews.title: Good travel/camping pillow
customer_reviews.text: When I initially took the pillow out of its stuff sack I wasn't entirely impressed. Once I washed and dried it once the pillow puffed up much better. I do wish that the pillow's stuffing was heavier on the memory foam side rather than the "fluff", but I still feel like it should work out pretty well. The pillowcase is nice and soft, and the stuff sack is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Molnar

customer_reviews.title: Nice size - needs time to expand before use
customer_reviews.text: Nice size for camping without taking up too much room in my motorcycle saddlebag. My only concern is - right out of the stuff-sac the pillow was quite lumpy. Directions suggest letting it expand before using. I let it sit for an hour and it seemed to improve but I will not know if this is a comfort issue until I let it sit out for a few hours on an upcoming trip.
customer_reviews.author: Not the manufacturer

customer_reviews.title: Compact travel pillow - packable, but decent support
customer_reviews.text: I needed a travel pillow that would provide the support of my pillow at home without being the size or weight of that pillow. This fits the bill AND it is a pillow and removable pillow case all in one, so the pillow case can be washed between trips, or toss both in for a thorough clean. It also comes with a stuff stack, to store it even more compactly, if you need that.
customer_reviews.author: WileEC

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfy Pillow
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several WiseOwl products and this Camping/Backpacking Pillow just rocks. It's an absolute worthwhile investment. It's damn comfortable and very well made and the price is very reasonable, considering the exceptional night's sleep you'll get on the trail. I'm a dedicated WiseOwl products fan and this is where I'll spend my money!!
customer_reviews.author: Karl P

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact pillow
customer_reviews.text: The pillow is good for travel and it does compress into its travel bag. It takes some force to get it in the bag, once it comes out. It is not as comfortable as I was expecting, but I believe that is because I was expecting a memory foam type of pillow. This is a foam pillow, but it is a bit bumpy because it seems to be pieces of foam instead of a larger piece of foam. Still a great pillow and I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Hirschel

customer_reviews.title: Best pillow
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pillow for camping but I love it so much I use it everyday, it's my favorite pillow. So fluffy and soft but small and the positioning of my next seams better.
customer_reviews.author: reppepdawg

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Picked this item up as a luxury item for hiking and am glad I did. If you're looking to use this for backpacking I would recommend the small, it's big enough to be comfortable but will take up a lot less space in your pack. Also, I found it was easier for me to pack it without putting it in the stuff sack it comes with (obviously this will vary depending on your own pack and other items but I figured it was worth mentioning). For me it was well worth the weight to carry it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Fluffed up better than I expected! Super lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: We bought the small for camping and they are great! You could use two if you need a lot of neck support or just fold one in half. They are very lightweight, fluff up nice and roll up easily. We have already recommended them to other campers. I like that my kids can carry them because they are so lightweight. I love how they can be washed!
customer_reviews.author: Bgoggi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome travel/camp pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a medium size camp pillow to start and I immediately loved it so I bought two more in the large size! My girlfriend and I use them often for camping and trips to the cabin. The pillow is very comfortable. It provides more support than most pack pillows I've used. It's also easy to wash. It's not super compressible so if backpack space is a premium you might want to look at the small or a more compact option. It's perfect for car camping, fishing trips, or any time you can toss it in a small duffel.
customer_reviews.author: ryan vanasse

customer_reviews.title: You’ll be glad you got it
customer_reviews.text: There are lighter pillows that will pack smaller...specifically inflatable pillows. Forget about those. I take it backpacking and I couldn’t be happier. It’s comfortable. It’s lightweight. It’s awesome. I had friends on my last trek that had inflatable ones and some that didn’t even have one and they wanted it. One of them tried it for five minutes and almost fell asleep when she’d been having difficulty doing so.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: You need this pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a backpacking trip and had the best nights sleep ever! It is compact and lightweight, so it doesn't take up much space or add to the weight your carrying, while also fluffing up enough to provide support throughout the night. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: good, small pillow
customer_reviews.text: I think this will be great for travel and camping. It feels lumpy in your hands like it's filled with cubes, but not when you have your head on it. I noted one small lump that had a relatively hard surface one one side, but haven't noticed it during sleep or while falling asleep. I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: xeric mama

customer_reviews.title: Nice but small
customer_reviews.text: The pillow is solid and very comfy. The size small is a little small- I’m super petite but for the average person I def suggest a bigger size. The pillow case is removable and washable which is a big plus. The only downside, I had to practice 5x before I could get it back in the storage bag...
customer_reviews.author: Kim Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Compresses ... sometimes not enough, other times too much
customer_reviews.text: Got this pillow for camping. It's not as big as I thought it would be and in hindsight wished I ordered the next size up. When sleeping with it under my head, it compressed more than I would like, particularly for a side sleeper. More concerning though, it how tough it is to get it into the stuff sack. It is a very tight fit, and takes me multiple attempts to get the pillow compressed enough to fit in the stuff sack. Would be easier if the bag was a wee bit bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a "hugger" pillow
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little pillow for extra support. I got it for nightly use as a "hugger" pillow. I like to have a pillow for arm support and this is perfect. Literally the only issue I have with it is that it's really hard to get the cover off and put it back on after washing. I will be making a small case for it.
customer_reviews.author: CFitzRN

customer_reviews.title: Surprising little guy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super fluffy with the perfect firmness to support for its size. It isn’t difficult to roll up either and get back in to the accompanying stuff sack. It comes with a zippered pillowcase which you can wash on its own. However I did throw the entire pillow into the washing machine (cold) and dryer (low) with my regular wash and it came out just perfect! I’d highly recommend this for camping for its size and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: kenner

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy FIRM pillow
customer_reviews.text: If you like firm pillows (like memory foam) this is great. It's full of shredded polyurethane which makes for a surprisingly comfortable pillow. You can even squash the foam around to create a dimple in the middle. But at 9 oz (small), this is pretty heavy for backpacking - but otherwise great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Blais

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is amazing. I hated those blow up awful uncomfortable pillows. This one however is fantastic. Of course it is not as small as an inflatable but it compresses well. It's filled with pieces of what feel like memory foam so it feels like or better than a typical pillow and the fabric on the outside is incredibly soft. A Must have for camping, hammocking (especially if you like reading while laying in your hammock) and long flights. A++
customer_reviews.author: David Kiyak

customer_reviews.title: Picture is deceiving.
customer_reviews.text: Folded up it looks smaller than the pillow. In its stores pouch it is the size of a small sleeping bag. Also is chunky pieces of foam not one solid piece. Is good sized pillow. I'm a side sleeper so I use another pillow on top.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Fluffy and Washable
customer_reviews.text: It was surprisingly very fluffy. I washed it and it held up well in the washing machine maintaining the fullness after I fluffed it. The stitching looks well constructed. I purchased it for a homeless man and it's comfortable to sleep on. The only reason I gave it a 3 - average for traveling is because it's a pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Works great for camping/overnight hiking!
customer_reviews.text: Liked -super comfortable -good quality -removable cover to make cleaning easy Disliked -not as compact but to be honest, still worth when you’re sleeping in a tent and don’t like those dumb blow up pillows -storage bag should be slightly larger, stuffing the pillow in creates a vacuum so the bottom is difficult to fill all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: Very good travel pillow. I suffer from neck problems and this little guy fits perfectly on top of a regular size hotel pillow. Easy to pack is is very sturdy but is not too stiff that you can’t get comfortable. Used it for the past few days and will now remain in my suitcase for all my travels.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole A. Barry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot so I wanted a pillow I could conveniently carry on planes that was also comfortable. This pillow fits both requirements perfectly. It rolls small I to its bag,only takes a minute to remove and fluff up. Soft and comfortable for sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be happier
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pillows for an overnight canoe trip, and I couldn’t be happier. They were extremely comfortable for both my girlfriend and I. I even use my pillow at home when taking a nap on the couch. I also purchased the three pack of dry bags from Wise Owl. The smallest bag had a small hole in it. Wise Owls customers service answered my email in less then 24hrs. They immediately sent me a replacement bag. I will definitely be buying from Wise Owl again!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Guinter

customer_reviews.title: Def not super comfy
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is better than sleeping with your head on the ground, but it's still not comfortable. You can feel all the individual foam pieces and it makes it very lumpy. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Almost a perfect hiking pillow
customer_reviews.text: I love Wise Owl Outfitters products. They are all made well and have never let me down. This pillow is no exception. My only minor gripe is the compression sack could be a little smaller. The pillow is more compressible. I started using a different sack and this helps the packability of the pillow in my hiking bag.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Griffo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I really did order this one by mistake. Thought it was a inflatable pillow. But I’m happy with it. Super comfortable cover feels cool on your skin. I have it 3 stars on travel due to its size when compressed. It’s bout football maybe little smaller. Best thing to do open it before you want use it fluff it up and give it time to decompress you’ll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Not a big fan, Lumpy.
customer_reviews.text: I must be one of the rare customers that didn't like this pillow. It seems like a nice pillowcase full of random foam remnants and is lumpy and not supportive. It is perhaps best suited for car/plane or backpacking, but I have tried several other camping pillows that I much prefer to this one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Takes about 30 minutes for pillow to reach "max comfort"
customer_reviews.text: Upon first getting the pillow and opening it I didn't think it seemed very "foamy" but after an old fashion pillow fluffing and allowing the material to expand for 15-30 minutes before use it actually becomes quite the comfort item. When topped on my sleeping pad it definitely added that last bit of support I needed to have a well rested night for those multi-day backpacking ventures. Mind I did even only get the small size one for packing purpose. The only thing that would've been nice due to the materials ability to expand would've been a sack with a little bit more of compression strap to allow to be even more travel friendly. Over all though. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Best camping pillow - twice
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been camping for many years, and this is my favorite pillow for camping and travel in general. It’s the only one I’ve ever owned that compresses well and then expands to a comfortable and supporting level. Others have fallen flat, literally. I liked this pillow so much I’ve now gotten a second one!
customer_reviews.author: <REDACTED>

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is a great product. I like it and use it every day. I will take it with me when I travel. It doesn't compress as much as an inflatable pillow, but it is a lot more comfortable. Because of the compressability issue, I don't think it is a back packing kind of pillow.
customer_reviews.author: read til you drop

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I now have 4 of these pillows that I take camping with me (2 for me 2 for my friend) and they're simply great pillows. they're not tiny and not huge either so they're Ideal for car camping, road trips, hotels, whatever you need them for. The only thing I didn't like is the stuff sacks, it's hard to get the pillows into them and they don't really compress them down much so I carry all the pillows I have compressed in a large compression sack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected -
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the BWCA trip in upper MN / Canada canoe trip. Tried blow up pillows, rigid pillows, all failed. This was the best so far, wish it was a bit bigger, It compresses down fairly well, as space is limited. Over all, it is now my pillow of choice on those trips.
customer_reviews.author: Cea JaysTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I had a different travel pillow before that I used to clip on to my bag when I went backpacking around Italy, but it didn’t have a cover so it got dirty pretty fast. I’m replacing it with this one since this has a sealed bag with a clip so I can also attach it to my bag when I travel and for easy storing/getting. It’s also bigger than my previous one.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: My backpacking pillow
customer_reviews.text: I use this pillow while backpacking. It’s extremely light and pretty dang comfortable in my hammock. I’d would definitely recommend this item if you’re needing a small pillow for backpacking trips.
customer_reviews.author: North country

customer_reviews.title: don't buy this smelly pillow
customer_reviews.text: The pictures of this item are misleading. This camping pillow is actually pretty big. I bought it for backpacking and it would be way too big to fit in my pack. The item is difficult to get out of the stuff sack and good luck getting back in. The cover feels cheap. Also the pillow is also lumpy and misshapen due to the way they’re packaged - didn’t puff up evenly after being left out either. Also, has a really weird chemical smell that doesn't go away. Literally nothing good about this item! Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of that pillow, a blue and a orange one. First I bought the wrong size but it was easy to change. Finally the blue one is much softer than the orange one. I make a return and got an new orange pillow. But it's the same problem. The pillow content is so hard like wooden pieces and flocky. The blue was after some time soft and okay. But the orange not. I'm wondering is this a orange pillow problem or I was only lucky with the blue one.
customer_reviews.author: Madmich

customer_reviews.title: Plush packed pillow (PPP!)
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is great for camping and travel. It easily compacts and expands which makes it ideal for transport. The 12x16" dimensions make it the size equivalent of a football at a fraction of the weight. The pillow fabric is soft, and protected within the confines of the carrying case. Bonus points for being machine washable and dryable!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Light ,compactable
customer_reviews.text: Nice and compactable,soft covering,will be fine for hammock camping.Only thing is there's chunks of memory foam,somewhat undiserable,yet not bad.I did find a nicer pillow,a bit bigger,way more like a pillow.Still memory foam but finer,more like home pillow,does not compact as well.I was looking for something with less loft,which is not necessary for sleeping in a hammock.
customer_reviews.author: raymond

customer_reviews.title: Great size, soft and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Took this pillow on a backpacking trip. It’s soft, comfortable, light weight for packing. Loved it. I had ordered a different one previously which was too big, I loved this pillow!
customer_reviews.author: Trudi Newman

customer_reviews.title: Skip it
customer_reviews.text: Just opened up the package and almost an entire side seam is wide open. The pillow also seems to be misshapen due to the way they’re packaged - didn’t puff up evenly after being left out either. The stuffing is difficult to move around by hand. It’s compact for sure but not the most comfortable. Would probably only recommend if your only other option is no pillow at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra A.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Overall I liked the pillow a lot. It was comfortable for a recent 4 night camping trip on the Green River in Utah. I'm not sure if I would take it on backpacking trip just because it's not super compactable, but the comfort was worth the trade off.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Comfortable and Plush
customer_reviews.text: This packs down very small, but quickly expands to a plush, comfortable pillow that provides plenty of head and neck support. It's well-made and should hold up well to the rigors of travel or camping - and it works great in a Wise Owl double hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Villines

customer_reviews.title: Finally a real pillow for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is absolutely owl standing! After purchasing several different styles of camping pillows I believe the folks at wise owl have nailed it! Almost full size pillow with plenty of firm cushion! And it's machine washable!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hill

customer_reviews.title: Not as impressed as others.
customer_reviews.text: I used it for a camping trip & it is just too small & not that comfortable. I thought it would be great by reviewing the reviews, but I wasn't impressed at all.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Simon

customer_reviews.title: Great Pillow
customer_reviews.text: Bought and used for a six hour flight and it was perfect. Fill of pillow allows you to adjust it and it holds the shape. Better than any neck pillow I’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: doesn't go in the way it came out
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of a smaller pillow with its own case for traveling. Pillow is perfect size and fits in carry on bag. However, it does not go back into storage back easily...and for me, not at all. i wish cover was a tad bit bigger. Pillow also lumpy, but still comfortable. Worth the purchase if you don't care about a cover and will fit in your carry on luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie marshall

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid of getting a tiny pillow that had barely any support, but the Wise Owl pillow really was quite full of head-supporting fluff. The only problem was trying to compress it enough to get it back into the carrying bag. After figuring out the best way to roll it tight the process went smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: WAY Better then an air pillow!!!
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth carring for my weekend back packing trips. Compared pillows with my freinds and hands down we all agreed this was the best pillow from the group. Works great on long road trips for the kids. I Totally recommend! I bought the large which is the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: sassysummit

customer_reviews.title: Can’t handle washing machine on gentle cycle
customer_reviews.text: Well it was a good pillow until I had to wash it after mom son returned from scout camp. I checked everything and it was fine and it said to wash it in the cover. There was a little one inch gap in the zipper of the cover and the pillow itself apparently exploded and burst the seam and now it’s all over the washing machine and everything else in the laundry room... lovely...won’t be buying another one ever. These should be heavy duty seams inside and out!!! It survived camp just fine but not the gentle cycle in a large washing machine??? So sad...
customer_reviews.author: C. Dischinger

customer_reviews.title: Primo camping and travel pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I got a new mummy bag in the summer and bought a "camp pillow" from another company. This thing barely was big enough for my head. And as far as compressibility goes it was nil. The Wise Owl compressible pillow is amazing! This thing expands to at least double it's packing size and the support feels great. Also the material on the outside is very soft. I've used it camping and on a plane and it is amazing! Highly recommend if you are in the market for a camping or travel pillow.
customer_reviews.author: John Michael Milburn II

customer_reviews.title: Cute and portable pillow
customer_reviews.text: This camping pillow came packaged in a cute carry case. I liked the soft material of the pillow case which is zippered so you can take it off and wash it. The pillow is perfect for supporting your back, neck and head. Love how small and portable it is.
customer_reviews.author: Yuthana Kong

customer_reviews.title: Great pillows!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pillows for backpacking for extra comfort while sleeping. Not only were they comfortable but these pillows were the perfect size (medium 14*18)and fit really well in our backpacks. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Preciado

customer_reviews.title: Great Company
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow for my Wife. It took a bit to fully fluff up. Once it comes to life, as she puts it, it is extremely comfortable. Even comes in it's own stuff sack. Very comparable to my therma rest pillow. I highly recommend you check out Wise Owl.
customer_reviews.author: MoosemanMike

customer_reviews.title: Great little pillow especially for kids
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old refuses to get an adult pillow. All his prior little pillows flatten easily and quickly. This is a bit lumpy which I didn’t think he’d like but this pillow has maintained shape and support! Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, hard plastic inside pillow
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is filled with chunks of foam, some of which are attached to hard chunks of material, which appears to be plastic and is sharp. Also, when the inner pillow was removed from the cover there was significant yellow staining on a supposedly new pillow. This was disturbing and is probably unsafe to use.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very nice travel pillow Foam filling fluffs up nicely for a comfortable Pillow small is just the right size for my back I do have difficulty getting pillow in and out of bag pillow is easy to roll up but bag is tricky
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as comfortable as my home pillow
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is not meant for Ultra Light packing as it does weigh some and it's a mid to large size pillow. However, for comfort, this pillow is legit. It does fit nicely into your pack and I honestly recommend it. Best sleep ever with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rose

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The pillow is great and comfortable. Only down side is the size packed. It’s not the same size of the air up ones but you trade packing for comfort. It’s well worth the space it takes up compared to the air up ones.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Mayhall

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Wise Owl
customer_reviews.text: This company is thoughtful and goes beyond limits to provide exceptional and personal care to their consumers. Although I wasn’t happy with my original purchase, they were eager for feedback, and as a result I am a very happy recipient of the Wise Owl product. Love a company that cares.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So far I have never been disappointed with my wise owl products and this is no exception. The pillow is surprisingly comfortable and I like how it rolls up into the “stuff sack”. Its small size makes it great for travel and camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Wise Owl Outfitters Camping Pillow Compressible Foam Pillows – Use When Sleeping in Car, Plane Travel, Hammock Bed & Camp – Great for Kids - Compact Small, Medium & Large Size - Portable Bag
feature_bullets: Better Than All Other Pillows - Guaranteed!

START SLEEPING IN COMFORT! Our packable camping & travel pillow has memory foam like cushioned support with a soft micro-suede cover giving you a truly supportive rest that you and your head will be thankful for. Resting while traveling has never been more comfortable. With our 5-inch-thick pillow you’ll get a great night sleep!

COMPACT WITH CONVENIENT BAG FOR EASY PACKING! Designed with a drawstring closure to keep your size small pillow compressed down into a 9” x 6” stuff sack, 10 ½” x 6” in the medium size & 12" x 7" in the large size fitting easily into a backpack suitcase briefcase or tote. Machine washable and dryer friendly for easy clean up as well!
LIGHTWEIGHT PORTABLE PILLOW IN THREE SIZES! The small size expands to 12 x 16 (9 oz.), the medium 14 x 18 (11 oz.) and the large 16 x 23 (13 oz). Great for adults, kids and even a toddler!
FIND THE PERFECT MATCH FOR YOUR CAMPING GEAR! We offer 5 bold colors for you to choose from!
100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE - If for ANY reason you do not love your pillow let us know and our USA based customer care team will take care of you no questions asked!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
